title: [K-12] Formative Assessment Design for Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Based on GeoGebra Classroom

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts (Equations, Functions, Geometry) and Experience with GeoGebra’s Basic Features
context.additional_context: Utilizing mobile-optimized features of GeoGebra Classroom in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can visually represent the problem-solving process of given math problems using GeoGebra Classroom’s interactive tools.
Learners achieve an 85% or higher final answer submission rate by revising and supplementing problem-solving strategies based on formative assessment feedback.
Learners enhance their ability to analytically interpret GeoGebra simulation results for various math problem types (equations/geometry/functions).

resources: GeoGebra Classroom account and assignment templates
GeoGebra utilization manual for teacher training
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
